instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message:
Hi, my client macbook Pro retina Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Trackpad and Keyboard jams/stuck sometimes and does not work to click on. When I use external keyboard and mouse its working fine.

What could be the problem?

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message: What Mac is this? 2015? 2014? If it’s a 2015 inspect trackpad and trackpad flex for corrosion

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 35293"]What Mac is this? 2015? 2014? If it’s a 2015 inspect trackpad and trackpad flex for corrosion[/QUOTE]

Thanks for quick reply.. Would u suggest I put it through the Ultra sonic cleaner?

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message: If 2015 model, try another flex cable. These always fail.

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message:
[QUOTE="phuketmymac, post: 35299"]If 2015 model, try another flex cable. These always fail.[/QUOTE]

Thanks phuketmymac.. I will order a new flexcable.. and try it out.. :)

does anyone else have any other suggestion i could troubleshoot?

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message:
I second phuketmymac. The 2015s have a cable that runs over the battery and between the case. This commonly fails due to the MacBook being held with 1 hand and also from small particles becoming stuck to the flex cable tape underneath and pressing into the cable. I see this about 1-2 times a week. 
This model uses ForceTouch. 2013-2014 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>'s do not and are similar to previous models, with a lip and button. This could simply be dirt around the lip. Unfortunately, this is not very user serviceable, as the battery is glued in and would need to be removed to access the TP. 

Easiest way to tell if its a 2015 is when the machine is off, the trackpad will not click at all. (Of course if your mechanism is stuck, this doesnt help).

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message: It is the flat cable in most non liquid damaged cases.

threads.title: Macbook pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Trackpad and Keyboard stuck
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 35369"]It is the flat cable in most non liquid damaged cases.[/QUOTE]

Thanks duke.. Great support.. :)
